message: Any one know how to reference jQuery in the Master Page C# ? Mohammed Hossam, Mahmoud Abd El-Fattah, Mohamed El Sayed, Mohamed Meligy & Mohammad Tayseer Please guys any help will be appreciated :D

data.message: this is the error i get: Uncaught ReferenceError: _$ is not defined

Are you using a script manager? if you are not you might be having some trouble writing the right path for jQuery script in your page, especially if your master page is not on the same level as your other pages.
This is exactly what's happening, I'm not using a script manager . the question here is what's the correct way to attach it in the master page ?
If you are using a Script Manager it is easy, because you can reference the script from the root folder using ~/ so wherever the page that ends up using the Masterpage it will have the right path
One more thing you can do, if you don't wanna use Script manager, is to use one of the public online jQuery CDN's I believe Google was providing one let me fetch that for you

You can use something like the following without Script Manager:
<script src='<%= ResolveUrl("~/Scripts/jquery-1.6.2.min.js") %>' type="text/javascript"></script>
And make sure that the file you referenced in the jQuery one, and I would recommend to redownload it again in case of download issues (md5check)
Ahmed Magdy VS don't like the = sign in the <%= ResolveUrl %> ... I managed to embed it using the Google CDN Thanks to Mohammed Hossam :)
It's working with me all of the time! But good to go with CDN
